observation: Solvent Systems Inc.  Home About Us Contact Us Welcome to Solvent Systems, Inc. Solvent Systems, Inc. and its subsidiary, SSI Distributing, are St. Louis-based companies that specialize in helping end-users, retailers and consultants keep abreast with the ever-increasing demands for information, product and service in today's volatile and increasingly competitive computer market. Read more... Sales We understand both the complex world of computers and your  particular needs for your home and business. Support Our locally-owned and operated company  has been servicing customers like you since 1983. Service & Repair We offer high-quality, personalized support for your servers, computers, and networks. Data Recovery Has your existing computer system died? We have the expertise to restore and rebuild your data systems. 13118 Maple Drive Sales, Service, One doesn’t happen Copyright © Solvent Systems, Inc. All rights reserved.

thought: The WHOIS information shows that the domain is registered and has been in existence since 1996, which is a good sign of a legitimate business. The domain registration doesn't expire until 2024, and the domain status indicates it is not available for transfer, update, renewal, or deletion, suggesting a stable ownership. The use of a privacy service is common and does not necessarily indicate fraud. The domain has been recently updated, which is a good sign. To get a better understanding of the website's credibility, I should check for secure connections and certificates.

The lack of certificate information could potentially be a concern, as secure websites typically have SSL/TLS certificates that can be validated. However, it's possible that the tool isn't retrieving the data or that the certificates are managed in a way that's not visible to this tool. I should continue to investigate other aspects of the website to make an informed decision. Next, I will check the DNS records to gather more technical details about the website's setup.

The DNS records show that the domain has a valid A record pointing to an IP address, as well as MX records for handling email, which are typical of a legitimate business website. The presence of SOA and NS records also supports the idea that this is a standard domain configuration. Based on the given characteristics of fraudulent websites and the observations from my analysis, I should now make a determination about the legitimacy of the website. The website does not display the typical characteristics of a fraudulent website. It has been registered for a long time, has a stable presence, and shows no immediate red flags in its content, WHOIS information, or DNS records. Although there was no certificate information available, this alone is not sufficient to classify the website as fraudulent. Therefore, I conclude that the website is likely legitimate.

observation.reason: The website has a long-standing domain registration stable WHOIS information legitimate DNS records and an online presence with customer reviews which suggest it is a legitimate business and not a fraudulent website.
